billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION

votes.description: Cultural Affairs, Tourism, Parks and Recreation

title: Exempts operators of law enforcement vessels from laws which regulate vessels on the navigable waters of the state while responding to emergencies
summary: Exempts operators of law enforcement vessels from laws which regulate vessels on the navigable waters of the state while such operators are in the course of responding to emergencies.
pastCommittees: CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          922

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  MARCELLINO  -- read twice and ordered printed, and
         when printed to be committed to the  Committee  on  Cultural  Affairs,
         Tourism, Parks and Recreation

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  navigation  law,  in  relation  to providing an
         exemption from certain laws for operators of law  enforcement  vessels
         responding to emergencies on the navigable waters of the state

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The navigation law is amended by adding a new section  39-b
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  39-B. LAW ENFORCEMENT VESSELS. 1. THE OPERATOR OF A LAW ENFORCEMENT
    4  VESSEL, WHEN INVOLVED IN AN EMERGENCY OPERATION ON THE NAVIGABLE  WATERS
    5  OF  THE  STATE, MAY EXERCISE THE PRIVILEGES SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION TWO
    6  OF THIS SECTION, BUT SUBJECT TO THE CONDITIONS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISIONS
    7  THREE AND FOUR OF THIS SECTION.
    8    2. THE OPERATOR OF A LAW ENFORCEMENT VESSEL  MAY  DISREGARD  ANY  LAW,
    9  RULE  OR  REGULATION  OF  THIS  STATE OR ANY LOCAL LAW OR ORDINANCE OF A
   10  MUNICIPALITY OF THIS STATE GOVERNING THE MOVEMENT OR TURNING OF  VESSELS
   11  UPON SUCH NAVIGABLE WATERS.
   12    3.  THE PRIVILEGES GRANTED TO THE OPERATOR OF A LAW ENFORCEMENT VESSEL
   13  PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL  APPLY  ONLY  WHEN  AUDIBLE  SIGNALS  ARE
   14  SOUNDED FROM ANY SUCH VESSEL WHILE IN MOTION BY BELL, HORN, SIREN, ELEC-
   15  TRONIC  DEVICE  OR  EXHAUST  WHISTLE AS MAY BE REASONABLY NECESSARY, AND
   16  WHEN THE VESSEL IS EQUIPPED WITH AT LEAST ONE LIGHTED LAMP SO THAT  FROM
   17  ANY  DIRECTION,  UNDER  NORMAL ATMOSPHERIC CONDITIONS FROM A DISTANCE OF
   18  FIVE HUNDRED FEET FROM SUCH VESSEL, AT LEAST  ONE  BLUE  LIGHT  WILL  BE
   19  DISPLAYED AND VISIBLE.
   20    4.  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL NOT RELIEVE THE OPERATOR OF A
   21  LAW ENFORCEMENT VESSEL FROM THE DUTY TO OPERATE  SUCH  VESSEL  WITH  DUE
   22  REGARD  FOR THE SAFETY OF ALL PERSONS, NOR SHALL SUCH PROVISIONS PROTECT
   23  THE OPERATOR FROM THE CONSEQUENCES OF HIS OR HER RECKLESS DISREGARD  FOR
   24  THE SAFETY OF OTHERS.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04398-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the navigation law, in relation to providing an exemption from certain laws for operators of law enforcement vessels responding to emergencies on the navigable waters of the state
